article.title: Afghan
article.paragraph: Afghan(Pashto languagePashtoalsoGujariPersian languagePersian: ; seeAfghan (ethnonym)etymology) refers to something fromAfghanistan, particularly a citizen of that country. Prior to this definition, it was used by Persian speakers and those influenced by the Persian language to denote thePashtun people. In modern times, "Afghan" is rarely used as an ethnic term for thePashtun PeoplePashtunsbut is rather used as the nationaldemonymfor all citizens of AfghanistanPashtun PeoplePashtuns,Tajik peopleTajiks, and also a large number ofHazara peopleHazaras,Uzbek peopleUzbeks,Aimaq peopleAimaqs,Turkmen peopleTurkmens,Baloch peopleBalochs,Nuristani peopleNuristanis,Pashayi peoplePashayis,Pamiri peoplePamiris,History of Arabs in AfghanistanArabs,Brahui peopleBrahui,Jat,Gurjar, and others.

As an adjective, the word Afghan also means "of or relating to Afghanistan or its people, language, or culture".
article.heading: Afghan
article.paragraph: InFarsilanguage, the word 'Afghan' literally means whining, wailing, and bawling. The word also carries some negative connotations among non-Pashtuns. For instance, amongHazarasHazara,TajiksTajikandUzbeksUzbek, the word Afghan is metaphorically used to denote backwardness. Among ethnic Hazara, 'Afghan' attains its meaning through a semantic shift, as 'Awgho' and it is often used in the households to scare the children for obedience. Historically, Hazaras have suffered at the hands of Pashtuns, and in their literature, Pashtuns are psychologically portrayed as evil, terror, savage, oppressor, and uncivilized people. This kind of portrayal has also shared among Uzbeks, Tajiks andTurkmensTurkmen. Similarly, in northern Afghanistan among non-Pashtuns, the word 'Afghan' has also experienced a semantic change, which is 'Awghan,' and both metonymically and metaphorically used as a swear word to shame someone for wrongdoing and in contemptuous way it means representing someone as an object of ridicule.What do we know about the word Afghan and who is called Afghan? article.heading: Afghani
article.paragraph: The term "Afghani" refers to the unit ofAfghan afghaniAfghan currency. It is often improperly used for a person or thing related to Afghanistan.cite webMore on Afghanihttp://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/chatterbox/2001/10/more_on_afghani.htmlSlate.comMarch 29, 2013The incorrect use of the term may have originated during theSoviet war in Afghanistanwhen millions of Afghans took refuge in neighboringPakistanandIran. The Afghani was created in 1925. Between 1925 and 1993 varieties of Afghani coins and banknotes were in circulation through Afghanistan. Coins issued during this period consisted of: 1, 2, 3, 5, 10, 20, 25 pul in bronze, brass, copper nickel, and aluminum-bronze; silver , 1, and 2 Afghani; and gold , 1, and 2 amani. Banknotes issued were in: 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 500, 1000, 5000, and 10,000 Afghani. In 1958 bank notes worth 2 and 5 were switched with coins.cite webhttp://famouswonders.com/afghan-afghani/Afghan Afghanifamouswonders.com
